E
N
DATE:
April 14, 1954
T
Attached are copies of two letters from Marcus Cohn. Since
several thousand dollars of the increased annual NAEB expenses, as
well as your own, are due to the higher shipping charges this year for
sound tapes beyond Zone 3, which represents nearly 2/3 of the tapes
shipped to and from our Headquarters Office, some or all of you may be
interested in carrying on with this. The next to the last paragraph
of Marcus0 October 13 letter explains why the NAEB as an organization
can not bring any pressures to bear in this instance. This does not
prevent individual members from getting together outside the framework
of the NAEB to see what can be done to get tapes and records, as well
as films, to qualify for the lower rates which last year went into
effect, but were not applicable beyond Zone 3*
enclosures
ccs NAEB Officers
Cohn and Marks
DAVI
